contentrichtext.text: <noinclude>{{../doc}} {{divhide|Staging area}} ==Images== Use only ONE image at a time <gallery> File:HMS Dreadnought 1906 H61017.jpg|HMS Dreadnought File:Melbourne Midway small.JPG|HMAS ''Melbourne'' Image:Prince Albert-1842.jpg|Prince Albert, consort of Queen Victoria </gallery> ==Ineligible== {|class="wikitable" |- !Blurb !Reason |- | [[1763]] – Britain, France, and Spain signed the '''[[Treaty of Paris (1763)|Treaty of Paris]]''' to end the [[Seven Years' War]], significantly reducing the size of the [[French colonial empire]] while at the same time marking the beginning of an extensive period of British dominance outside of Europe. | lead too short |- | [[1841]] – The [[Parliament of the United Kingdom|British Parliament]] passed an '''[[Act of Union 1840|Act of Union]]''' abolishing the legislatures of [[Lower Canada]] and [[Upper Canada]] and establishing a new political entity, the [[Province of Canada]], to replace them. | no footnotes |- | [[1846]] – The forces of the [[East India Company|British East India Company]] defeated the army of the [[Sikh]] kingdom of the [[Punjab region|Punjab]] at the '''[[Battle of Sobraon]]''', the decisive battle of the [[First Anglo-Sikh War]]. | refimprove |- | [[1996]] – '''[[Deep Blue (chess computer)|Deep Blue]]''' defeated [[Garry Kasparov]] in a game of [[chess]], the [[Deep Blue – Kasparov, 1996, Game 1|first ever game]] won by a [[Computer chess|chess-playing computer]] against a [[World Chess Championship|World Chess Champion]] under chess tournament conditions. | already featured on [[Wikipedia:Selected anniversaries/May 11|May 11]] |} ==Eligible== {{*mp}} [[1840]] – '''[[Albert, Prince Consort|Prince Albert]]''' of [[Saxe-Coburg and Gotha|Saxe-Coburg-Gotha]] married [[Queen Victoria]] of the United Kingdom at the [[Chapel Royal]]<!-- in [[St James's Palace]]-->, becoming [[List of British consorts|prince-consort]]. {{*mp}} [[1862]] – [[American Civil War]]: A [[Union Navy|Union naval flotilla]] destroyed the bulk of the [[Confederate States of America|Confederate]] [[Mosquito Fleet]] in the '''[[Battle of Elizabeth City]]''' on the [[Pasquotank River]] in [[North Carolina]]. {{*mp}} [[1906]] – The [[Royal Navy]] battleship '''{{HMS|Dreadnought|1906|6}}''' was launched, representing such a marked advance in naval technology that her name came to be associated with an [[Dreadnought|entire generation]] of battleships. {{*mp}} [[1936]] – [[Second Italo-Abyssinian War]]: The '''[[Battle of Amba Aradam]]''' began and ended nine days later in a decisive [[tactical victory]] for Italy and the neutralisation of almost the entire Ethiopian army as a fighting force. {{*mp}} [[1962]] – "'''[[Vilyam Genrikhovich Fisher|Rudolf Abel]]'''", a Soviet spy arrested by the [[Federal Bureau of Investigation|FBI]], was exchanged for [[Francis Gary Powers|Gary Powers]]<!--Not bolded, tagged with {{refimprove}}-->, the pilot of the [[Central Intelligence Agency|CIA]] spy plane that had been [[1960 U-2 incident|shot down]] over Soviet airspace two years earlier. {{*mp}} [[1964]] – The [[Royal Australian Navy]] aircraft carrier [[HMAS Melbourne (R21)|HMAS ''Melbourne'']] '''[[Melbourne–Voyager collision|collided]]''' with the destroyer [[HMAS Voyager (D04)|HMAS ''Voyager'']] while both were performing manoeuvres in [[Jervis Bay]] in [[New South Wales]], Australia, killing over eighty of ''Voyager''{{'}}s personnel. {{divhide|end}} </noinclude> '''[[February 10]]''': '''[[Lunar New Year]]''' ([[Chinese calendar]], 2013); '''[[Public holidays in Malta|Feast of Saint Paul's Shipwreck]]''' in Malta <div style="float:right;margin-left:0.5em"> [[File:Namdaemun Fire-2.PNG|The fire at Namdaemun in 2008|100x100px]] </div> {{*mp}} [[1258]] – [[Hulagu Khan]] and the [[Mongol Empire|Mongols]] '''[[Siege of Baghdad (1258)|sacked and burned]]''' [[Baghdad]], a cultural and commercial centre of the [[Muslim world|Islamic world]] at the time, ending the rule of the [[Abbasid]] [[caliph]]ate. {{*mp}} [[1567]] – After an explosion destroyed the house in [[Kirk o' Field]], [[Edinburgh]], where he was staying, the strangled body of '''[[Henry Stuart, Lord Darnley]]''', the [[List of Scottish consorts|King consort of Scotland]], was found in a nearby orchard. {{*mp}} [[1930]] – The [[Viet Nam Quoc Dan Dang]] launched the failed '''[[Yen Bai mutiny]]''' in the hope of ending [[French Indochina|French colonial rule]] in Vietnam. {{*mp}} [[1939]] – [[Spanish Civil War]]: The [[Francoist Spain|Nationalists]] concluded their '''[[Catalonia Offensive|conquest of Catalonia]]''' and sealed the border with France. {{*mp}} [[2008]] – The [[Namdaemun]] gate in [[Seoul]], the first of South Korea's [[National Treasures of South Korea|National Treasures]], was '''[[2008 Namdaemun fire|severely damaged]]''' by [[arson]] ''(damage pictured)''. </ul> {{SelAnnivFooter|Month=February|Day=10}}<noinclude> </noinclude>
